inspection_fees: For projects with a total valuation of $500.00 or less, a $20.00 fee is charged for each inspection. A general re-inspection fee is $40.00.
expedited_review_fees: Typically an additional 50% premium on standard permit costs.
resubmittal_fees: No explicit 'resubmittal fee.' A re-inspection fee of $40.00 is charged for rejections. A new permit can be obtained for half the original fee if work was suspended for less than six months.
temporary_certificate_fees: Commercial: $100.00. Residential: $50.00. A bond of 1/4 of the total building permit fee (minimum $250) is also required.
demolition_permit_fees: $0.10 per square foot of floor area, with a minimum fee of $50.00.
water_capacity_fees: A "Wastewater Availability Charge" for the Perla Wastewater System. As of Jan 1, 2025, monthly charges range from $20 for a 5/8" meter to $106.67 for a 2" meter.
sewer_capacity_fees: Assessed for new commercial or industrial users if their discharge rate exceeds a per-acre allowance. Calculated on a project-specific basis.
water_transmission_fees: No specific 'water transmission fees.' Costs are covered by the Infrastructure Investment Fee, Availability Charges, and other general water rates. N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
sewer_transmission_fees: Comprised of a monthly Service Availability Charge based on meter size (e.g., $12.93 for a 5/8" residential meter) and Volumetric Charges for Operations and Debt Repayment based on water consumption.
transportation_fees: Rock Region METRO Bus Day pass: $3.75. 10-Ride pass: $11.50. 31-Day pass: $36.00. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
parks_recreation_fees: Varies by facility and activity. E.g., The Centre at University Park has a daily adult fee of $1.50 and various rental fees. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
public_safety_fees: Includes various Fire Department fees. E.g., Fire sprinkler installation for a 5,000 sq ft building is $200 ($0.04/sq ft). A fire alarm test for a building up to 3 stories is $100.
fire_protection_fees: Includes fees for fire sprinkler systems, suppression systems, and fire alarms. For example, a fire alarm test for a building up to 3 stories is $100.
library_fees: $72 annual fee for non-resident library cards. Overdue fines vary by item. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
school_impact_fees: No evidence of a direct school impact fee levied on developers. The school district may incur impact fees as soft costs in its own projects. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
general_government_fees: Includes various fees such as Traffic Court fees (e.g., $5.00 for certified copies) and miscellaneous building permit fees (e.g., $60.00 for a new commercial certificate of occupancy).
storm_drainage_fees: 'In-lieu fees' for stormwater storage are set at $10,000.00 per acre-foot.
water_meter_fees: Includes Availability Charge based on meter size, a Monthly Volume Charge, an Infrastructure Investment Fee, and a Watershed Protection Fee. Ancillary charges include $80 for a Stolen Meter.
sewer_connection_fees: Per Building Connection Fee: $100.00. Per Building (Initial Inspection) Fee: $155.00. Building Sewer Seal Fee: $205.00. Non-Permitted Sewer Connection Fee: $180.00.
water_service_line_fees: $1.00 monthly fee for the Sewer Service Line Replacement Program (SSLRP) for residential customers with a 3/4 inch or smaller water meter.
fire_service_connection_fees: Annual availability charges for sprinkler systems vary by meter size, e.g., $6.55 for a 5/8" meter inside the city.
reclaimed_water_fees: No separate 'reclaimed water fees.' Costs are covered by general residential, commercial, and industrial sewer rates. N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
utility_relocation_fees: If relocation is required by the City for public works, the costs are the sole responsibility of the utility company. N/A - Not a fee charged to developers.
grading_permit_fees: $100 for less than  acre; $200 for  acre to 1 acre; $100 for each additional acre.
drainage_fees_site: Fees are based on volumetric charges for operations and debt repayment, determined by water consumption. N/A - Not a site-specific fee, but based on usage.
private_street_fees: No specific fee labeled 'private street fees.' Related fees include a $40.00 per culvert permit fee for private driveways in Pulaski County. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
landscaping_review_fees: Typically between $50 and $100 per hour. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
irrigation_permit_fees: RPZ Irrigation System permit (requiring additional meter): $26.95. Inspection: $21.55. Data Processing Fee: $5 (residential) or $7 (commercial).
pool_spa_permit_fees: Permit fees are based on project valuation, with a minimum fee of $50.00. Hot tub or spa permit is $14.00. State-level plan review fee is 1% of estimated cost (min $50, max $500).
fence_permit_fees: Determined by the total valuation of the project, with a minimum fee of $30.00. For valuations of $500 or less with no inspection, there is no fee.
zoning_review_fees: Varies by application type and parcel size. Rezoning fees range from $100 to $610. Site Plan Application fees range from $150 to $400.
conditional_use_fees: Residential sites: $125.00 - $275.00. Nonresidential sites: $250.00 - $400.00, based on acreage.
variance_fees: Administrative Appeals: $75.00. Single/two-family variance: $100.00. Multi-family/nonresidential variance: $250.00. Sign variance: $60.00.
rezoning_fees: Varies by zoning district and parcel size, ranging from $100 (for R1-R3, 0-0.5 acres) to $610 (for I1-I3, M, over 40 acres).
planned_development_fees: Filing fees for planned zoning district applications range from $150 to $400 for residential sites and $300 to $400 for nonresidential sites, based on acreage.
design_review_fees: Commercial Plan Checking Fee is equal to one-half of the building permit fee, with a minimum of $50.00.
historic_review_fees: $100.00 for a Historic District Commission Certificate of Appropriateness.
environmental_review_fees: Typically costs between $1,700 and $3,500+ for a Phase I Environmental Site Assessment. N/A - Not a direct municipal fee, but a cost incurred by developers.
tree_removal_fees: Typically ranges from $506 to $690. Varies by tree size. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
wetlands_review_fees: The state permitting fee for wetlands review in Arkansas is $200.
air_quality_fees: The permit fee factor is $28.14/ton, effective October 1, 2023. This is a state-level fee, not specific to Little Rock.
noise_study_fees: No explicit fee listed. Covered under general variance application fees ($100 for single/two-family, $250 for multi-family/nonresidential). N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
traffic_study_fees: Specific fees are not publicly listed. Contact the Traffic Engineering Division for information. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
archaeological_fees: University of Arkansas Curation Fees: $350/cubic foot for artifacts, $175 minimum, $25/linear inch for documents. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
biological_survey_fees: No fee for Scientific Collection Permits required for biological surveys in Arkansas. N/A - Not a fee.
right_of_way_fees: $125.00 per application for right-of-way abandonment. A fee of $150.00 per article if the city removes an item from the right-of-way.
street_cut_fees: $7.00 per cut for commercial drives and $4.00 per cut for residential drives. Minimum fee: $30.00. Also, $2.00 per foot for the first 50 feet of boring/excavation.
traffic_signal_fees: Varying fees for Traffic Control Permits. No explicit fees for traffic signals themselves. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
street_lighting_fees: No universal fee. Costs are likely covered by general city funds. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
sidewalk_fees: Permit fees for sidewalk and driveway alterations are: residential drives, $4.00 per cut; commercial drives, $7.00 per cut. Minimum permit fee is $30.00.
driveway_approach_fees: Residential drives: $4.00 per cut; Commercial drives: $7.00 per cut. Minimum fee of $30.00.
oversized_load_fees: State-level fee: $17 for a special permit, with additional fees per ton per mile traveled.
electrical_permit_fees: New Construction (One- and two-family dwelling): $0.10 per square foot. Repair/Alteration/Addition: Based on unit cost schedules for meter loops, load centers, openings, etc. Minimum fee: $50.00.
plumbing_permit_fees: New Construction (One- and Two-Family Dwellings): $0.10 per square foot. Repair/Alterations: Based on unit costs (e.g., $6.00 per fixture). Minimum fee: $50.00.
mechanical_permit_fees: New one and two-family dwelling construction: $0.07/sq.ft. Replacements/repairs/alterations: $30.00 for the first $1,000 of valuation, plus $5.00 for each additional thousand. Minimum fee: $30.00.
fire_sprinkler_fees: For buildings 1 to 5,000 sq ft: $0.04 per square foot. For buildings 5,001 sq ft and up: $200.00 for the first 5,000 sq ft, plus $0.02 for each additional square foot. Minimum fee: $50.00.
elevator_permit_fees: State-level fees: Elevators: $150.00, Escalators/Moving Walks: $200.00, Dumbwaiters: $100.00, Wheelchair Lifts: $100.00, Major Alterations: $100.00.
tenant_improvement_fees: Not a direct municipal fee. Costs are typically handled through tenant improvement allowances (TIAs) from the landlord, which may be factored into the rent. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
subdivision_fees: State-level review fee: $100 for the first lot and $25 for each additional lot (max $1500). City fees start at $200 + $5/lot for sites under 5 acres.
platting_fees: Subdivision Application Fees range from $200.00 plus $5.00 per lot/acre for sites under 5 acres, up to $660.00 plus $5.00 per lot/acre for sites over 40 acres.
development_agreement_fees: Not explicitly listed as a distinct fee. Covered under various other planning and development fees. N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
public_improvement_fees: Costs for required public infrastructure (streets, water, sewer, etc.) are the responsibility of the subdivider. No specific city fee is charged. N/A - Not a fee, but a developer cost.
bond_processing_fees: Standard bail bond premium is 10% of the bond's face amount, plus a non-refundable $20.00 fee for the Arkansas Public Defender Commission. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
application_fees: Varies by institution, e.g., $40 for UA Little Rock. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
hearing_fees: $15.00 for a CD Recording of a Traffic Court Hearing.
appeal_fees: $5.00 to appeal from Little Rock District Court, plus a $140.00 Circuit Court filing fee. Civil and Misdemeanor Appeals (Electronic Record): $185.00.
modification_fees: $75.00 for Land Use Plan Amendments and other requests to modify a Master Plan element.
extension_fees: $30.00 for each ninety-day extension for building permits.
after_hours_fees: An additional fee of $100 is applied after a car has been booted by parking enforcement. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
coastal_commission_fees: Little Rock is an inland city and has no coastal commission. N/A - Not applicable.
airport_overlay_fees: No specific fee referred to as an 'airport overlay fee' was found. N/A - Not found in relevant local municipal sources.
flood_zone_fees: Floodplain development permits can cost $1,000-$5,000+. Flood studies can range from $5,000-$20,000+. Pulaski County charges $25 for floodplain development permits.
seismic_review_fees: No explicit 'seismic review fee.' Likely included in the general Commercial Plan Checking Fee. N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
wildfire_prevention_fees: No specific 'wildfire prevention fee.' Covered by various fire prevention and inspection fees, such as fire sprinkler system permits. N/A - Not a distinct fee category.
desert_conservation_fees: No specific 'desert conservation fees' exist for Little Rock. N/A - Not applicable.
school_district_fees_specific: Varies. E.g., the CARE Program has a $60 registration fee and monthly fees starting at $42. N/A - Not a municipal development fee.
water_district_fees_specific: Includes various charges from Central Arkansas Water: Availability Charge (e.g., $10.44/month for 5/8" meter), Volume Charge, Infrastructure Investment Fee (e.g., $0.75/month for 5/8" meter), and Watershed Protection Fee.
fire_district_fees_specific: Varies by system type. Fire Sprinklers: $0.04/sq ft for buildings up to 5,000 sq ft, with a minimum of $50. Other systems like standpipes, CO2, clean agent, foam, range hood, and dry chemical have specific fees ranging from $200 and up.
improvement_district_fees: Varies by district. Generally includes a 'Penalty' (10% or 25%) and a 'Cost' (10%).
assessment_district_fees: Typically a 10% 'Cost' fee is applied to Special Improvement District assessments. Penalties for late payment can be 10% or 25%.
